title: Rail strike: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: first great western ( fgw ) operating revised timetable with limited capacity .
workers from rmt union into second day of 48-hour strike .
a 24-hour stoppage on london underground ended on thursday night .
fgw dispute centres on row over new trains .

documents.title: goodbye
text: thank you for joining us on day two of the first great western ( fgw ) train strike .
keep up-to-date on talks between the unions and fgw on the bbc news website .

documents.title: passengers 'grateful ' says fgw manager
text: one first great western manager , who wanted to remain anonymous , told bbc news : `` generally the response from passengers [ during the strike ] has been great - they know we 're doing our very best to keep them moving in difficult circumstances and they have been very grateful for what we are doing .
`` all the managers and other staff who have turned up to work have been pulling together to do our very best for customers . ''
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: rmt thanks public
text: on day two of the 48-hours strike , mick cash , rmt general secretary said : `` the solidarity , unity and fighting spirit of rmt members the length and breadth of the fgw franchise has been a fantastic example for the whole trade union movement as we face up to attacks on our jobs and conditions and the safe delivery of services to the travelling public .
`` our have reported strong public support for this action as the people who use these routes know only too well what profiteering and cuts mean in terms of ‎their safety and the quality of service .
rmt wants to thank the public for that support . ''
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: fgw to talk with the union
text: as the strike draws to a close first great western operations director ben rule paid tribute to his staff who worked during the last 48hrs and said he would talk with the rmt union .
in a statement he said : `` i am sorry that customers have been affected by the rmt 's strike action over the past couple of days - and will continue to be so tonight .

`` my first job next week will be to sit down with the rmt and discuss the issues that led to the strike further - we were very close to an agreement before the strike and i am confident there is a negotiated solution to be found here . ''
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'stressed out beyond belief '
text: elaine mundt , who is from new york and visited her friend in helston , cornwall , said : `` i think i 'm going to miss my flight back to new jersey it costs hundreds of dollars to buy new flights last minute .
ms mundt said it was the first time in almost 40 years she had seen her friend and the return journey had `` stressed her out beyond belief '' .
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: ed sheeran wembley stadium concert warning
text: wembley parking
we are expecting large numbers of vehicles for # edatwembley today due to the @ twitterid strike !
please arrive earlier this evening , many thanks

documents.title: rail strike : latest headlines
text: we have less than two hours of the rmt strike on first great western and these are the latest headlines :
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'fantastic staff '
text: anne dinsdale , who is travelling from penzance to norwich , said her journey to plymouth had been `` absolutely amazing '' and the staff had been `` fantastic '' .
`` i 'm not looking forward to the next bit .
delays are one thing but train cancellations are another , '' she said .
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: southern rail deal made
text: planned strikes by engineers on southern railway due to start this weekend have been suspended after a breakthrough in last-minute talks .

members of the rail , maritime and transport union were due to walk out from 17:00 on sunday for five days , and not work any overtime this weekend , in a dispute over the working week , rosters and productivity .
general secretary mick cash said the company had agreed to a phased reduction in the working week to 37 hours by may 2017 .
meanwhile , the rmt said the second day of a strike by its members on first great western in a separate dispute over new trains was being `` solidly '' supported .
author: Press Association

documents.title: fresh fgw ballot 'impact not expected '
text: first great western ( fgw ) says a ballot of a `` small minority of managers '' by the transport salaried staffs ' association was `` not expected to have an impact '' on services .
the union is asking more than 300 managers to
`` many of those volunteers would normally manage our onboard teams on a day-to-day basis , and have anything up to 18 years experience of the role .
dozens more managers have volunteered to help in non-safety critical roles at stations and on trains . ''
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: strike satisfaction
text: some passengers have been taking to social media to thank first great western for their service during the strike .
trains are so packed due to delays that i 'm sat nice and cosy on the floor .
nice carpets though @ twitterid
@ twitterid sorry about this sadie , the services are busier than usual because of the strike action at the moment .

@ twitterid ah it 's okay do n't worry the carpets are soft and the people are friendly , thank you for the updates as we go too it helps a lot
@ twitterid apologies for the uncomfortable journey , we are making the best out of what we have available to us -andy
@ twitterid do n't worry i 'm happy here on the floor
kudos to the @ twitterid staff who did come in today , it must be really difficult to bear the brunt of a lot of people 's ( understandable ) anger

documents.title: 'third class service '
text: the transport salaried staffs ' association ( tssa ) has called a ballot on industrial action at first great western , the union has
manuel cortes , general secretary , said : `` proposed reductions in on-board staff numbers will have a serious impact on passenger safety .
of course , standard class passengers will also get a third class service as they will no longer have access to a buffet car .
put simply , you ca n't rely on the trolley service on busy express trains . ''
the tssa and national union of rail , maritime and transport workers fear
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: first great western : 'no plans to axe guards '
text: first great western have again rejected one of the main reasons the
operations director ben rule said : `` it is more than a little frustrating that with all the rhetoric flying around there is still some confusion over this key issue .
there are categorically no plans for us to axe guards from the new super express trains - in fact , i want more of them . ''

documents.title: rail strike : travelling hopefully
text: peter bunce from swindon is braving
he said when he heard the strike was taking place he was `` a bit annoyed as the trains do n't run on time at the best of times '' .
as a result he came to the station an hour early and `` hoped things would be ok '' .
author: Matt Pengelly
Local Live

documents.title: first great western passenger 'misery '
text: commuters look set to face more travel misery today as first great western train services endure their second day of strikes , reports
rmt members walked out yesterday over safety and job loss concerns with the introduction of a new hitachi intern city express trains .
the strike came at the same time as that of london underground workers , creating a perfect maelstrom of travel chaos for millions of commuters .

today , fgw spokeman james davies claimed that `` over 90 per cent of trains '' in the london thames valley area were running normally - but conceded that elsewhere service was considerably affected .
author: The Independent

documents.title: rail strike : latest headlines
text: as the 48hr rmt strike enters its final hours , here are the latest headlines :
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more train delays
text: thousands of rail travellers face potential delays and disruption again today as the 48-hour strike by rmt union members on first great western trains continues , reports the
the dispute over jobs and safety concerns has seen high-speed services between london paddington , the west and wales halved .
cricket fans heading out of london to the ashes test match in cardiff are among those affected .
a 24-hour strike by the rmt and transport salaried staff union on london underground which ended last night compounded the misery .
author: Western Daily Press

documents.title: second union calls for fgw ballot
text: the transport salaried staffs ' association has called a ballot on industrial action at first great western , the union has
it 's asking more than 300 managers to vote for action short of a strike in a ballot which opens on july 15 and closes on july 24 .
manuel cortes , general secretary , said : `` first great western senior management think that they can just order our members about at will .
they are being instructed to do jobs which they do not feel either qualified or confident to do . ''
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: catherine bearder : striking alienates the customer
text: liberal democrat mep for the south east of england , catherine bearder , has called on the rmt union and first great western to
she says : `` these days we need to have a think about how industrial action works - it does n't really impact on owners or bosses but the customers .
if owners lose revenue they put the prices up .
`` i believe in sitting around a table negotiating a deal - that 's much better than attacking the long-suffering customer . ''
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: at the scene : plymouth railway station
text: despite the strike of a reported 2,000 first great western employees across the network , the majority of trains leaving and arriving at plymouth were on time or only slightly delayed .
although many services have been cancelled , with the branch lines being the main victims , the car park was reasonably full and station busy with rail users and commuters .
most people were positive ahead of their journeys , although some feared they would miss connections and flights .
author: Chris Ellis
BBC News Online

documents.title: reserving the right to strike
text: the guardian 's gaby hinsliff
she said : `` without it , employees are defenceless in the face of exploitation , which is why being able to withdraw one 's labour is essential to civilised society .
`` but it 's precisely because it 's such a powerful weapon that striking should n't be abused . ''
author: The Guardian

documents.title: rail strike : effect on oxford
text: i 've been at oxford railway station this morning to see what impact
abdur razzak says his journey was trouble free .
`` i 'm half an hour later than usual because of the amended timetable , but i told my employer and they were fine with it so it 's no problem . ''

there has been a dramatic fall in customer numbers in the shops in oxford station , according to the manager of the west cornwall pasty co stephen tilley , he tells me that it had been very quiet the last two days - usually he would expect to do 50 % of the day 's business in the morning rush hour , but he says his and the other shops had seen nowhere near that .
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail strike social media strategy
text: train company
more than 11,300 tweets have been received - about four times the normal volume - a team of four has replied to 70 % of them .
a fgw spokesman said : `` on twitter we can speak directly to customers so it really comes into its own during disruption in times like this .
`` it 's been great to hear so many positive comments this week , when we are running more than half of services .
of course we do get some negative ones as well , but we just want to make sure people have all the information possible to get where they have to go to . ''
author: Matt Pengelly
Local Live

documents.title: the bigger

author: The Spectator

documents.title: rail strike : outside oxford station
text: it 's been eerily quiet in the sunshine at oxford railway station today .
it seems many people heeding
canadian ryan chen-wing has allowed an extra hour for his journey into london , so he can make his connection as he travels to new haven .
he said `` as i 'm on holiday i can spare the time and i do n't really know about the politics of the strike , but if i was working then i would be a lot more worried . ''

it 's not only the businesses inside the station that have seen a drop in customer numbers , outside kamini patel from citysightseeingoxford told me : `` usually friday and saturday are the busiest days here , but it seems very quiet in the station .
the whole area is less busy . ''
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail strike : oxford latest
text: at the moment oxford station is a of calm .
passengers are making their way through the concourse easily and all the departure boards are showing trains leaving on time , despite
it may or may not be connected , but the cycle racks outside oxford station , which are usually full to overflowing , appear a little less busier today , with spaces available .
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail strike : the in swindon
text: despite the
local stephen appleton , who has a visit to a convention in london planned , said he was worried the strike could `` mess up his whole day '' .
and karen sevilla from kemble , who was seeing her daughters off to an ed sheeran concert in the capital , described the reasons for the strike as `` nonsense '' and `` not worth all the fuss '' .
author: Matt Pengelly
Local Live

documents.title: hope for new talks over rail dispute
text: striking railway workers have urged first great western to get back to the negotiating table as the action which has crippled the network enters its second day , reports the
the rail , maritime and transport workers ( rmt ) union said support for the action was `` rock solid '' with out in force at many stations .
although the 48-hour stoppage is due to end at 18:30 , it is unlikely the service will get back to normal until tomorrow when workers clock back on to their shift .
author: Western Morning News

documents.title: rail firm 's side of the story
text: it 's worth recapping that first great western say the new trains , which are at the centre of the row , will actually need more workers not fewer .
mark hopwood

`` there will , however , be an impact on some of our engineering depots when maintenance work on the new trains transfers to the train provider as part of their contract procured by government , '' he said .
author: Michael Stoddard
BBC News, Southampton

documents.title: rail strike : view from the line
text: union leaders have paid tribute to the `` fighting spirit '' of their activists and workers as

rmt general secretary mick cash said : `` the solidarity , unity and fighting spirit of rmt members the length and breadth of the fgw franchise has been a fantastic example for the whole trade union movement . ''
author: Andrew Humphrey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tube back running
text: london underground services are back to normal after a 24-hour strike closed the entire system , causing travel misery for millions of commuters and holidaymakers .
the walk-out ended last night but no tubes had run all day , forcing people to take packed buses or boats , switch to bikes or walk .
london underground bosses have contacted the conciliation service acas to help arrange fresh talks over the dispute , although any meetings are not expected until next week .
author: Press Association

documents.title: rail strike : hope for more trains services
text: managers at first great western say they 're hopeful they will be able to run more services than timetabled on

a near-full service is running in the london and thames valley area and about 50 % of long-distance services are running - but local branch lines outside the thames valley are generally not able to run .
there 's
a fgw spokesman said : `` we had more people turn in for work than expected yesterday , which increased the number of people available for us to run trains by around 10 % . ''
author: Matt Pengelly
Local Live

documents.title: train users take to social media
text: commuters and train users have taken to social media to vent their anger or offer praise to both the national union of rail , maritime and transport workers and first great western .

documents.title: oxford rail delays
text: the rail strike caused delays and disruption for passengers travelling to london from oxford yesterday , reports the
the industrial action began after 11th-hour crisis talks between rail bosses and union rmt broke down on wednesday .
fgw said a reduced number of trains for rail passengers travelling from oxford to london paddington will operate , but with delays and cancellations to be expected over the strike period .
author: Oxford Mail

the
`` there are limited services returning from cardiff to bristol parkway and london paddington following the cricket ( 17:55 and 19:25 ) .
these services will be extremely busy so we recommend customers make alternative travel arrangements where possible . ''

Local Live

text: the london underground is back to normal after
a good service is operating on all tube lines this morning following yesterday 's # tubestrike .

documents.title: train strike row escalates
text: the rhetoric between the rmt union and first great western
but the train firm disputed the claims , saying safety was its top priority and a service would not run without the correct number of trained employees .

BBC News Online

documents.title: tube strike comes to an end
text: there 's some good news for commuters today with tube services resuming following a
the capital was plunged into travel chaos , with a marked increase in commuters using overground , bus and boat services .

transport for london ( tfl ) said a `` good service '' was expected this morning - the rail , maritime and transport ( rmt ) union congratulated members who had participated in the action over pay and night services .
author: BBC London News

some have asked what we 're doing to resolve the dispute with the rmt .

documents.title: follow strike action travel updates
text: find out which services are disrupted today by following first great western 's

documents.title: second day of action
text: it 's a
the firm is expecting to run a similar service to thursday with london-bound services from cardiff , bristol and swindon expected to run every hour .
but branch lines in cheltenham , looe in cornwall , from bristol to weymouth , to newquay and to gunnislake are expected to be severely reduced or cancelled .
